channel.title: RS German?
channel.description: well i was thinking.. runescape has got a german thing... so why not [url=http://moparisthebest.com]moparisthebest[/url] and [url=http://moparisthebest.com]moparscape[/url] have a language change button to german. it would bring a few more members. oh and i have no clue what you would do if you was to do this k ;)

[center] [/center]

item.title: RS German?
item.dc:creator: @dudeofthed dudeofthed
item.description:
@dudeofthed wrote:

Mod Taharok:

There is a SMF package that allows multi-language support, but it doesn’t translate the posts or topics. That is why Moparisthebest probably has never added the package. Plus, it would be too much work to add a package since it will be rarely used.

You can use the babelfish web translator. It translates all links clicked on. It worked for one forum i know of. All Mopar will need for this is the babelfish website translator.

Read full topic

item.title: RS German?
item.dc:creator: @ednat0r55 ednat0r55
item.description:
@ednat0r55 wrote:

german is like a “dead” language. most people that are here speak english real well. have you noticed that in runescape there are practically “no” germans playing on german servers? Also, have you notived that everyone that you just messaged replied back because they know english as well?

if you shove food up your butt, will you poo from your mouth?

[br][size=1]Posted on: April 07, 2007, 10:59:05 AM[/size][hr]oops mispelled noticed. XD

Read full topic

item.title: RS German?
item.dc:creator: @kmb Kmb
item.description:
@kmb wrote:

Bowser, I know one at least one admin and a mod here who understood most of what you typed there in Danish or Norwegian, because Finns are forced to learn Swedish for some absolutely retarded reason. Swedish is no use for me in the future, mostly because Swedish people can speak English.

exe: Mostly correct, though you did generalize a bit too much.

Finally ontopic: Agreed with the post above, silly idea.

Read full topic

nearly All off the mods don’t understand it so how can they know if it are against the rule?

item.title: RS German?
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

[quote=“lothy, post:16, topic:67495”]I don’t see why there’d be a language rule anyway. Google can give a pretty rough translation.

Although, most people in countries like Germany, Denmark and Japan learn English as part of their schooling. We’ve got a German exchange student and a Denmark exchange student at school at the moment, and both have really good English skills.[/quote]

A friend in my street was born Russian and he’s brilliant at English(I’d say 99% perfect).

Most English schools teach French, or Spanish, I’d imagine country’s like Japan or China would have a course in English.

Read full topic

item.title: RS German?

item.description:

[quote=“Javacisnotrecognized, post:13, topic:67495”][quote author=Mopman link=topic=98661.msg1010935#msg1010935 date=1173853960]
I’ve just realised there is no rule on language here. I could have sworn there was.
[/quote]

[/quote]

Try != “You Must”.

Also, I believe that is in reference to the “no leet speak” rule.

There is no rule on the official rules thread or the TOS that says you must speak English.

So don’t underline your screenshots at me.
